summary: The document is a memorandum from January 10, 1975, concerning a name trace request for Henry L. Bretton and Praeger Publishing Corporation. It outlines the findings from checks across multiple files, revealing that Henry L. Bretton, also known as Henry Bismarck, was a former OSS operative who had agency contacts in 1964 but wished no further involvement. Additionally, Praeger Publishing Corporation served as cover for Arthur W. Cox during a project until his retirement in 1962. The memorandum was prepared to address a request by ACC, with a response deadline of January 13.
key_findings: Henry L. Bretton, alias Henry Bismarck, was identified as a former OSS operative.
Bretton had agency contacts in 1964 but expressed no desire for further involvement.
Praeger Publishing Corporation was utilized as cover by Arthur W. Cox for a project until his retirement in 1962.
The memorandum was created to fulfill a request by ACC, with a specified deadline of January 13 for the response.
